formalText: She's feeling pretty proud of herself right now.
She's both picky and kind of skeptical about things.
Sermons in general tend to piss her off.
She really likes going to church in some ways.
She has no idea why she actually believes and she doesn't find very many priests that are comfortable admitting that they don't know.
She woke up this morning and was really not doing well.
She slept 2 hours later than she meant to because she woke up and she couldn't get up.
She can't do this, and then she'd go back to bed and set her alarm for another half an hour.
She couldn't get started.
She was wanting to hurt herself and was doing really bad.
She kind of sat there and thought well, her therapist would probably say that something about feeling this way sucks, but it's millier.
So it was kind of comforting for her.
She thought well, it is comfortable in the sense that as long as she is incapacitated like this,
she doesn't have to figure out what to do next.
She can say kind of this isn't really her fault.
She doesn't have to think.
She doesn't have to actually solve the problem.
She was thinking about anything else.
That was all she's been thinking about for the last couple of days.
She thought okay, and then she felt better.
She feels like her depression and anxiety just makes her a worse person consistently.
Certainly a more selfish person
It sucks to be misunderstood.
Sermons in general tend to piss her off.
She wonders why this is happening to her
and why this is her life.
She hears a lot of suffering will bring her closer to God, and she hears a lot of suffering will help her be a better person and understand other people better or be closer to other people.
She doesn't feel like either of those are the case.
She feel like she just gets more and more alone and less and less capable of seeing anything outside of herself.
She  likes when she's doing badly and she talks to somebody about it at the end of it.
She sort of feels like great, now
they're both unhappy. Awesome.
She thinks her job for at least the next month is kind of to keep her anxiety under control.
Which that's kind of a full-time job.
Too bad
she doesn't get paid for that.
She feels like she's getting better at it though.
It's like the last couple of days it kept getting worse and worse.
And worse. But she also kept feeling like she just needed something to snap her out of it and she wasn't able to find that.
She's sure there is more to it.
Then she suddenly felt better.
But that's kind of what it felt like.
She thinks it was that she hadn't looked at it that way and then said, okay.
Well, that's the case then.
She doesn't know whether that's true or not.
But if she acts like that's true, then the next thing for her to do is figure out what she's going to do next and say book.
She actually has to figure out what she has to do next.
But she talked to James again and said no, she pretty much just has to keep doing the same thing.
It's not time for her to decide that she failed at this yet.
Now she just gets to be anxious.
Maybe she's a little anxious to be mad and critical.
Usually she's pretty comfortable being mad and critical at the sermons.
She has been kind of the skeptic in the feudal for a long time.
But on this topic, she's anxious about it.
The last couple of days there's nothing really new to say; it's pretty much the same thing happening.
It kind of happens over and over and over.
She feels like James gets frustrated with her about that or she worries about that.
She feels like if her life sucks, at least it should suck a new way.
Or if it sucks in the same way, she should be able to come up with something to do about it.
She talked to her sister on the phone yesterday and she was doing pretty badly.
She didn't want to go into too much detail about not doing well because then she starts crying on the phone and all of those things.
For her, when she's with somebody when she's suffering,
she can't think about the other person at all.
She can't enter the other person's life.
She can't talk about the things that the other person wants to talk about.
It's like she don't have anything to give and that sucks.
She feels terrible about that.
She told her sister what was going on and that she was having a bad day and that she was anxious about finding a job and haven't heard back from anywhere etcetera, etcetera.
But to try to summarize why she's not doing well takes about 30 seconds.
And then she just has the same things to say over and over and over again.
That's all she's got.
It's like this huge giant thing for her that's blocking out everything else.
They always have these weird conversations.
It's like she's pretty good at keeping the focus off of herself, and then she feels kind of resentful about it, which doesn't help.
It's like they can either have the conversation about her or they can have the conversation about her sister.
It doesn't feel like both can happen in the same conversation.
So she can either tell her sister what her life is actually like right now, or in order to listen to her sister at all,
she sort of has to pretend that the rest of her life doesn't exist.
She also doesn't know what else to say to her sister because she told her how it is.
Part of her is like she'd rather be alone in this than having other people hurting like this.
But she also sort of wants other people to be.
So clearly part of her wants other people to feel like this and she feels bad about that.
The problem she has is that now she has basically a month of waiting because she's applied to all of the positions.
She's applied for basically all of the positions that she would be a good fit for and are ones that she wants to apply for.
About 20 she thinks.
So now she basically has to sit for the next month and see if anybody calls her.
So that's going to be hard.

She has pretty much the same conversation with James once a week where she's so anxious that she's like well maybe she should just drop this all together and look at other fields, like look for a different job altogether. James always says if she takes a full-time job, she won't be able to teach next year.
If she gets a call, she won't be able to take it.
She can't do it.
Her friend was talking about anxiety and describing having a panic attack the other night.

She thinks he ended on that he said anxiety tends to Cripple us and keep us in her harness, and keep us from relating to people, and he was from looking outside ourselves, but it can also be this thing that spreads to connect with other people and to write to figure things out.
She doesn't find that anxiety
does that for her.
She really likes going to church in some ways.
She has no idea why she actually believes, and she doesn't find very many priests that are comfortable admitting that they don't know.
It is difficult for her to
deal with, even when she's not depressed.
It's always difficult for her to deal with.
Her sister is the same way actually, which is funny because she works at church.
Her sister is somebody she really trusts.
